This research is helpful to develop mobile devices with more signal stability, provides scientists with a new way to improve the design of MEMS resonators, and promotes the development of quantum acoustic systems.

中文标题: 加拿大开发出自供电生物传感器
整编内容: 近日，加拿大多伦多大学和滑铁卢大学研究人员合作开发出一种自供电生物传感器。生物传感器在可穿戴电子产品中很常见，这种设备可用于跟踪生物特征数据，如心率、含氧量或皮肤电导率等等，但它们通常由电池供电。研究人员使用新材料实现了从日常运动如走路中获取电能的功能。新材料由纳米纤维制成，研究人员在这种新材料中加入了天然聚合物木质素，在许多纸浆和纸制品中，木质素是需要去除的杂质，但是研究人员发现在纳米纤维中保留大约30%的木质素能够改善它们作为摩擦负材料的性能。通过将这种材料整合到摩擦电纳米发电机中，发现与使用聚四氟乙烯作为摩擦负层的类似设备相比，该设备能够多产生160%的电压和140%的电流，而且这种装置可插入鞋底，用户在走路或跑步时就可以发电。该成果将有望用于为生物传感器或其他无线设备供电。
关键词: 自供电生物传感器 纳米纤维 聚四氟乙烯 木质素
整编机构: 国家工业信息安全发展研究中心
源标题: Researchers envision wood-derived, self-powered biosensors for wireless devices
原文:
Wood-derived materials can be used to harvest electrical energy from everyday movements such as walking, according to University of Toronto and University of Waterloo researchers.
In a new study recently published in Nano Energy, the team demonstrated the use of lignocellulosic nanofibrils—derived from tree bark—in a prototype self-powered device capable of sending a wireless signal to a smartphone via bluetooth.
Such devices can be used to track biometric data such as heart rate, oxygen levels or skin conductivity. The innovation could improve the performance of these devices while lowering their environmental impact.
"Biosensors are common in wearable electronics, but today they are powered by batteries," says Ning Yan, a professor in the department of chemical engineering and applied chemistry in the Faculty of Applied Science & Engineering, and a co-author of the study.
"This makes them bulky, inconvenient and costly. Sensors without batteries could be thinner, smaller and cheaper. You would never again have to worry about forgetting to charge the battery. You could just stick it on your skin, and it would be powered by your natural movements," she added.
The principle behind the innovation is the trioboelectric effect, a form of static electricity. Because some materials attract electrons more than others, repeatedly bringing two different materials in contact and then separating them can cause an electrical charge to build up between them.
Researchers from around the world are experimenting with devices known as triboelectric nanogenerators, which make use of this effect to generate small amounts of electricity.
Most current designs incorporate synthetic materials such as polytetrafluoroethylene (PTFE), also known under the brand name Teflon. However, this material persists for long periods of time in the environment and concerns have been raised about its potential health effects.
Yan and her team wanted to see if it was possible to create a natural, biodegradable substitute.
"There has been some experimentation with using natural materials such as cellulose in these types of triboelectric generators," says Yan. "But most teams have used cellulose only in the layer that loses electrons, which we call the tribopositive layer. We wanted to develop a natural substitute for the other side, the tribonegative layer."
The new material is made of nanofibrils, tiny strands of plant material hundreds of thousands of times thinner than a human hair. Where other teams have used nanofibrils made of cellulose—the main plant polymer in paper and carboard—Yan and her team also incorporated another natural polymer known as lignin.
"Lignin is a complex, branching molecule," says Nicolas Tanguy, a co-lead author on the new paper who conducted the research as a post-doctoral fellow in Yan's lab (he is now at Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México).
"In many pulp and paper products, lignin is an impurity to be removed. But in this case, we found that leaving about 30 percent lignin in the nanofibrils actually improved their performance as tribonegative materials."
The U of T Engineering team sent the lignocellulosic nanofibrils to Professor Dayan Ban and his team at the University of Waterloo's department of electrical and computer engineering. They incorporated the material into a prototype triboelectric nanogenerator.
"Our key challenges were finding a highly efficient way to convert mechanical energy into electrical energy and then storing enough of that energy to power the system," says Ban, who completed his doctorate at U of T. "It was rewarding to achieve that while also limiting the environmental footprint of the multi-function system."
This device was able to generate 160 percent more voltage and 140 percent more current when compared with a similar device that used PTFE as the tribonegative layer.
Simply by tapping the device on an acrylic plate during testing, the prototype was able to generate enough power to send out a radio-frequency ping every three minutes that was picked up by a nearby smartphone.
In theory, such a device could be inserted into the sole of a shoe, with the user generating electricity while walking or running. The device could be used to power a biosensor or any other device that sends data wirelessly.
"Not only does this material perform better than PTFE, but it is also biodegradable," Yan says. "This would make it very useful in single-use biosensors. By eliminating both the battery and the PTFE, we are greatly reducing the environmental impact."
中文原文: 根据多伦多大学和滑铁卢大学的研究人员的说法，木材衍生材料可以用来从日常运动中获取电能，如走路。在最近发表在《纳米能源》上的一项新研究中，该团队展示了从树皮中提取的木质纤维素纳米纤维在一个原型自供电设备中的使用，该设备能够通过蓝牙向智能手机发送无线信号。这类设备可用于跟踪生物特征数据，如心率、氧气水平或皮肤电导率。该创新可以提高这些设备的性能，同时降低它们对环境的影响。“生物传感器在可穿戴电子产品中很常见，但现在它们是由电池供电的，”应用科学与工程学院化学工程与应用化学系教授、该研究的合著者宁岩说。“这使得它们体积大、不方便、成本高。没有电池的传感器可能更薄、更小、更便宜。你再也不用担心忘记给电池充电了。你可以把它贴在皮肤上，它将由你的自然动作供电，”她补充道。创新背后的原理是三电效应，一种静电形式。由于一些材料比其他材料更能吸引电子，反复地使两种不同的材料接触，然后将它们分离，会导致电荷在它们之间积累。来自世界各地的研究人员正在试验一种被称为摩擦电纳米发电机的设备，这种设备利用这种效应产生少量电力。目前的大多数设计都采用了合成材料，如聚四氟乙烯(PTFE)，也称为聚四氟乙烯（Teflon）。然而，这种材料在环境中长期存在，人们对其潜在的健康影响提出了担忧。严和她的团队想看看是否有可能创造出一种天然的、可生物降解的替代品。“在这些类型的摩擦发电机中，已经有一些使用天然材料如纤维素的实验，”严说。“但大多数团队只在失去电子的层中使用纤维素，我们称之为摩擦层。我们想开发另一面的天然替代品，即摩擦层。”这种新材料是由纳米纤维制成的，纳米纤维是植物材料的细小纤维，比人类的头发细几十万倍。在其他团队使用纤维素制成的纳米纤维的地方--纤维素是纸和纸板中的主要植物聚合物--严和她的团队还结合了另一种被称为木质素的天然聚合物。“木质素是一种复杂的分支分子，”这篇新论文的共同主要作者尼古拉斯·唐吉说，他作为严的实验室的博士后进行了这项研究（他现在在梅西科大学）。“在许多纸浆和纸制品中，木质素是一种需要去除的杂质。但在这种情况下，我们发现在纳米纤维中保留约30%的木质素实际上改善了它们作为摩擦材料的性能。”T大学的工程团队将木质纤维素纳米纤维发送给滑铁卢大学电气和计算机工程系的达扬·班教授和他的团队。他们将这种材料融入到一个原型摩擦电纳米发电机中。“我们的关键挑战是找到一种高效的方法将机械能转化为电能，然后储存足够的能量来为系统供电，”潘基文说，他在T.大学完成了博士学位。“在限制多功能系统的环境足迹的同时，实现这一目标是值得的。”与使用聚四氟乙烯作为摩擦层的类似器件相比，该器件能够产生160%的电压和140%的电流。在测试过程中，只需在压克力板上敲击设备，原型就能产生足够的电力，每三分钟发出一次射频ping，并被附近的智能手机接收到。理论上，这样的设备可以插入鞋底，用户在行走或跑步时发电。该设备可用于为生物传感器或任何其他无线发送数据的设备供电。“这种材料不仅比聚四氟乙烯性能更好，而且是可生物降解的，”严说。“这将使它在一次性生物传感器中非常有用。通过消除电池和聚四氟乙烯，我们大大减少了对环境的影响。”
中文源标题: 研究人员设想将木材衍生的、自供电的生物传感器用于无线设备
英文整编: Recently, researchers from the University of Toronto and the University of Waterloo in Canada cooperated to develop a self-powered biosensor. Biosensors are common in wearable electronics. Such devices can be used to track biometric data, such as heart rate, oxygen content or skin conductivity, but they are usually powered by batteries. Using new materials, researchers have realized the function of obtaining electric energy from daily sports such as walking. The new material is made of nanofibers. Researchers added natural polymer lignin to this new material. In many pulp and paper products, lignin is an impurity to be removed, but researchers found that retaining about 30% lignin in nanofibers can improve their performance as friction negative materials. By integrating this material into the triboelectric nano-generator, it is found that compared with similar equipment using PTFE as the negative friction layer, this equipment can generate 160% more voltage and 140% more current, and this device can be inserted into the sole, so that users can generate electricity when walking or running. This achievement is expected to be used to power biosensors or other wireless devices.

中文标题: 美陆军将于2022财年部署集成50千瓦级激光武器的斯特瑞克战车原型样机2

新型定向能机动近程防空系统（DE M-SHORAD）是一种集成了50kW 级激光武器的机动近程防空系统，旨在保护作战部队免遭无人机、旋翼和固定翼飞机、火箭、火炮和迫击炮的攻击。DE M-SHORAD 采用全新斯特瑞克战车，用于为激光武器的电池、冷却系统等供电。
2021年 7 月，在俄克拉荷马州西尔堡的一次战斗场景作战测试中，配备 50kW 级激光武器的斯特瑞克战车原型样机已证明了其能力。美陆军计划在2021年10月进行的“融合计划2021”联合演习中展示DE M-SHORAD的能力。除此之外，为进一步提升DE M-SHORAD系统性能，开发团队还将在未来几个月内进行小幅调整，并进行多次内部系统性能验证，以实现最终部署。

源标题: US Army to Field 50kW-class Laser-equipped Stryker Combat Vehicle Prototypes in FY 2022
原文:
The U.S. Army recently conducted a successful evaluation of a new directed-energy capability, moving the service one step closer to fielding a platoon of four laser-equipped Stryker combat vehicle prototypes next fiscal year. The Directed Energy Maneuver-Short Range Air Defense system, or DE M-SHORAD, is a 50kW-class laser designed to protect divisions and brigade combat teams against unmanned aircraft systems, rotary and fixed-wing threats, rockets, artillery, and mortars. The unique design of the DE M-SHORAD leverages the Stryker’s gas-powered engine to energize its batteries, cooling system, and laser.
“Our goal is to deliver prototypes that Soldiers can use as the mission requires and that the Army can leverage as a baseline for a program of record. A Soldier-centered design is a key part to reduce risk and to ensure an operationally effective weapon system. A strong partnership between the Army Rapid Capabilities and Critical Technologies Office and science and technology industry leaders led to the development and implementation of the first prototype in 24 months,” said Marcia Holmes, the deputy director of hypersonics, directed energy, space and rapid acquisition.
“The addition of the DE M-SHORAD and other directed-energy capabilities like the Indirect Fire Protection Capability-High Energy Laser, or IFPC-HEL, and IFPC-High Power Microwave are all designed to complement the Army’s kinetic air defense capabilities. There are places where directed energy can provide a significant advantage. All the bullets are built into the system, so the logistics associated with moving a platform and supplying it requires just gas and parts,”said Craig Robin, deputy director of the Rapid Capabilities and Critical Technologies Office’s directed energy project office.
The U.S. Army plans to demonstrate the DE M-SHORAD capabilities during Project Convergence 21, where it will participate in a joint and coalition exercise later this year. In July, the prototype proved its abilities during a combat shoot-off at Fort Sill, Oklahoma. During the event, Soldiers faced several realistic scenarios intended to refine future DE M-SHORAD characteristics, as program leads collected extensive data and user feedback to refine the system. In addition to Project Convergence 21, the DE M-SHORAD development team will make minor adjustments to improve the device’s performance in the coming months, followed by several internal system verifications.
中文原文: 美国陆军最近对一种新的定向能能力进行了成功的评估，使该服务离下财年部署一个排的四辆激光装备的斯特瑞克战斗车辆原型又近了一步。定向能机动-近程防空系统，或DE M-SHORAD，是一种50kW级激光器，旨在保护师和旅战斗队免受无人驾驶飞机系统、旋转和固定翼威胁、火箭、火炮和迫击炮的攻击。DE M-SHORAD的独特设计利用了Stryker的燃气发动机为其电池、冷却系统和激光供电。“我们的目标是交付士兵可以根据任务需要使用的原型，军队可以作为记录项目的基线。以士兵为中心的设计是降低风险和确保作战有效武器系统的关键部分。陆军快速能力和关键技术办公室与科技行业领导者之间的强大伙伴关系导致了24个月内第一架原型机的开发和实施，“高超音速、定向能、空间和快速采购副主任玛西娅·霍姆斯说。“DE M-SHORAD和其他定向能能力的增加，如间接火力保护能力--高能激光，或IFPC-HEL和IFPC-高功率微波，都是为了补充陆军的动能防空能力而设计的。在某些地方，定向能可以提供一个显著的优势。快速能力和关键技术办公室定向能项目办公室副主任克雷格·罗宾说：“所有的子弹都内置在系统中，所以与移动平台和供应平台相关的后勤工作只需要气体和零部件。”美国陆军计划在融合21项目中展示DE M-SHORAD的能力，并将在今年晚些时候参加联合和联盟演习。7月，原型在俄克拉荷马州希尔堡的战斗射击中证明了它的能力。在这次活动中，士兵们面临着几个现实的场景，这些场景旨在改进未来的DE M-SHORAD特性，因为项目负责人收集了大量的数据和用户反馈来改进系统。除了Project Congression 21之外，DE M-SHORAD开发团队还将在未来几个月内对该设备进行细微调整，以提高其性能，随后将进行几次内部系统验证。

整编内容: 洛·马公司正在为美陆军生产首批54枚远程精确打击导弹（PrSM），并开发结合射频传感器和光电红外传感器的多模末制导系统。陆军计划于2023年部署基础版PrSM，可从M270A1多管火箭炮系统和M142高机动性多管火箭炮系统发射，可打击480千米范围内目标，将取代部分MGM-140陆军战术导弹系统；到2025年，PrSM将配备先进的多模式导引头，能够摧毁海上移动目标。

源标题: Lockheed Martin to build 57 missiles with radio homing and infrared guidance to hit targets 300 miles away
原文:
Oct. 18, 2022
PrSM will be a surface-to-surface, all weather, precision-strike guided munition fired from the Army's MLRS and HIMARS artillery missile launchers.
John Keller
REDSTONE ARSENAL, Ala. –Tactical missile designers at Lockheed Martin Corp. are building some of the first U.S. Army long-range Precision StrikeMissiles(PrSM) to destroy enemy targets as far away as 300 miles.
Officials of the Army Contracting Command at Redstone Arsenal, Ala., announced a $77.4 million order last month to the Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire Control segment in Grand Prairie, Texas, for 54 PrSM missiles.
The PrSM, which should enter service in 2023, will be a surface-to-surface, all weather, precision-strike guided missile fired from the M270A1 Multiple Launch Rocket System (MLRS) and the M142 High Mobility Artillery Rocket System (HIMARS).
Last December Lockheed Martin won a $23.9 million order for PrSM full-scale development and early operational capability. The long-range precision-attack PrSM is to replace non-insensitive and cluster munition versions of the Army MGM-140 Army Tactical Missile System (ATACMS).
PrSM will provide Army and Marine Corps field artillery units with long range and deep strike capability. The PrSM will destroy, neutralize, or suppress targets at ranges from 43 to 250 miles using indirect precision fires.
Lockheed Martin and the Army are developing multi-mode terminal guidance for PrSM that combines RF signal sensors and electro-opticalinfraredsensors.
The missile uses Global Positioning System (GPS) satellite navigation and inertial gyro navigation to reach the vicinity of its targets. Once the missile reaches its target area, it listens for radio signals from enemy radar or communications to refine its targeting, and finally uses an imaging infrared sensor to pinpoint its target before impact.
Itsradio homingand imaging infrared guidance also will help the missile eventually reach moving targets on land and at sea.
The baseline missiles will be able to engage a wide variety of targets at ranges as long as 310 miles. It will emphasize imprecisely located area and point targets. Primary emphasis for follow-on upgrades will be on increased range, lethality, and ability to attack time-sensitive, moving, hardened, and fleeting targets.
By 2025 the Army will be able to use PrSM to attack and destroy moving enemy ships operating offshore at ranges out to about 310 miles. While the weapon primarily has surface-to-surface applications for use against enemy air defenses, troop fortifications, and armored vehicle columns, the PrSM is being configured with an advanced targeting multi-mode seeker to include maritime strike.
The new targeting seeker has completed a captive carry test wherein it flew aboard an aircraft against representative targets in preparation for further testing and ultimate deployment.
On this order Lockheed Martin will do the work in Grand Prairie, Texas, and should be finished by September 2025. For more information contact Lockheed Martin Missiles and fire control online atwww.lockheedmartin.com, or the Army Contracting Command-Redstone athttps://acc.army.mil/contractingcenters/acc-rsa/.

中文标题: 美国防部实施新的人工智能测试与评估协议
整编内容:
美国防部联合人工智能中心开始实施新的人工智能测试与评估协议，并根据此协议与79家供应商签订了合同，以简化测试和评估工具的采购与交付，每份合同价值高达1500万美元。
联合人工智能中心实施新的测试与评估协议旨在建立一个分散的人工智能测试与评估机制，为人工智能系统自动化测试创建标准、性能指标、规范和最佳方案，确保国防部人工智能测试工作的兼容性和标准化。在根据该协议签订合同的79家公司中，有44家是小型企业，35家是大型企业。
新的测试与评估协议的具体类别包括：测试技术与工具；数据集开发/管理；测试工具开发；模型输出分析；测试计划；文件；报告；测试服务；有针对性的测试与评估以及独立验证与确认；算法测试与评估；系统测试与评估；运行测试与评估；人为因素/用户验收测试与评估；项目管理。该协议将促进竞争，政府和私营企业合作伙伴都将在这一简化的采办策略中受益。
联合人工智能中心成立于2018年，是国防部所有人工智能工作的交流中心。在2021年12月的重组中，国防部设立了一名首席数字与人工智能官，专门负责监督联合人工智能中心、国防部数字服务以及国防部首席数据官的工作，以更好地简化数字化工作。

WASHINGTON — The Department of Defense’s artificial intelligence organization hasawarded contracts 79 vendors to streamline the procurement and delivery of test and evaluation tools, with each contract worth up to $15 million.
While companies began announcing their individual contracts in January, the Pentagon’s Joint Artificial Intelligence Center only confirmed the awards in a Feb. 10 statement to reporters.
The test and evaluation blanket purchase agreement on behalf of the Joint Artificial Intelligence Center is intended to establish a decentralized mechanism for artificial intelligence test and evaluation, creating criteria, performance metrics, standards and best practices for automated testing of artificial intelligence-enabled systems. Moreover, the agreement will focus on ensuring compatibility and standards for AI testing efforts across DoD.
Specific categories under the agreement include:
Test technology and tools; Data set development/curation; Test harness development; Model output analysis; Test planning; Documentation; Reporting; Testing Services; Targeted test and evaluation and independent verification and validation; Algorithm test and evaluation; System test and evaluation; Operational test and evaluation; Human factors/user acceptance test and evaluation, and; Project management 
Of the 79 companies awarded under the agreement, 44 are small businesses and 35 are large businesses, according to a spokesperson. They added that the agreement will foster competition in which both the government and private industry partners will mutually benefit from the streamlined methodologies implemented during this acquisition strategy.
The JAIC was created in 2018 to serve as a clearinghouse for all the DoD’s artificial intelligence efforts. In a December reorganization, the DoD created achief digital and artificial intelligence officerto oversee the JAIC as well as the Defense Digital Service and the DoD’s chief data officer in an effort to better streamline digital efforts.

中文标题: 2022年范堡罗国际航展航空飞机及发动机领域发展新亮点
整编内容:
范堡罗国际航展（FIA）于2022年7月18日至22日在英国举行，这是航空航天和国防工业方面的贸易展览会，可通过其了解后疫情时代这些方面的发展情况。以下是展会期间与航空飞机与发动机相关的一些新闻汇总：
英国罗罗公司和韩国现代汽车集团在FIA上宣布合作，计划将全电动推进系统和氢燃料电池技术引入先进空中交通（AAM）市场，从而将二者的优势技术有机结合。两家公司表示，氢燃料电池在全电动飞机推进系统中是一种零排放、低噪音且可靠性强的机载电源，可提高电力供应能力以及飞行距离，这项技术将推广到现代集团的RAM车辆以及罗罗公司的全电动混合动力推进系统中。
美国Joby Aviation公司宣布申请电动垂直起降飞机（eVTOL）在英国的设计认证。目前Joby已申请美国民航局（FAA）的飞机型式认证（TC），预计美国将成为其第一个运营市场，在获得英国民航局（CAA）认证后，Joby将成为第一家将FAATC进行外国认证的eVTOL公司，其在英国的发展进程也会大大加快。
英国的Vertical Aerospace、维珍航空（Crawley）等公司和机构宣布成立先进移动生态系统联盟，该组织将在两年多内共同开发一个关键技术和基础设施项目，包括创建和测试飞机电气化、空域管理、地面基础设施和操作程序等项目，帮助验证英国AAM生态系统的适应性，从而加速其引入英国市场的进程。
Vertical Aerospace正与英国航空航天公司Babcock International合作，探索其VX4 eVTOL飞机的新应用，据报道，该飞机的飞行里程超过100英里，最高时速可达200英里以上。此外，他们还将探索空中EMS和货运等其他领域的发展，包括开发模块化维护和维修能力，以便在偏远和严苛环境中对飞机进行经济高效的维护，从而最大限度地提升可用性。
英国可持续垂直飞行解决方案提供商Bristow Group Inc.与德国飞机开发商Lilium N.V.在展会上宣布建立战略合作伙伴关系，Bristow正式成为Lilium的授权服务提供商，旨在加强Lilium Jets发射网络方面的开发维护，此外Bristow可购买50架Lilium Jets。
另外，欧盟航空安全局（EASA）宣布城市空中出租车运营拟议规则，这是全球发布的首个此类法规的综合提案。拟议的新监管框架涵盖适航、空中运营、飞行机组许可和空中行驶规则等领域，补充了欧盟现有的运营监管材料，内容包括无人机驾驶系统（UAS）、U-space无人驾驶交通管理系统、eVTOL飞机认证以及EASA对垂直机场设计的指导等。
美国CFM International与法国Safran Aircraft Engines的合资公司正联合法国空客公司，对CFM的开放式风扇发动机进行测试，碳纤维增强聚合物（CFRP）叶片是该部件设计时的关键组成部分。CFM计划在美国GE航空飞行测试运营中心进行发动机地面以及飞行测试验证，第二阶段测试将在法国空客进行。
美国Boom Supersonic在范堡罗展示了Overture超音速商用客机的最新改进设计。经过2600万小时的模拟软件设计、5次风洞测试和51次迭代，改进后的飞机将以目前客机的两倍速度运载65-80名乘客，100%使用可持续航空燃料（SAF），水上速度飞行达1.7马赫，航程可达4250海里。其改进之处在于配置四台发动机以降低噪音和运营成本，机身前部直径大于后部以提高效率，采用鸥翼结构以改善操控性，以及通过碳纤维材料减轻重量并满足设计轮廓要求。此外，Boom Supersonic将配备一个新的70000平方英尺的硬件地面测试基地，以容纳其首个全尺寸Overture测试模型和驾驶舱模拟器。
英国GKN Aerospace表示，其H2GEAR氢电推进计划已完成第一轮系统研究，其研究重点是19、48和96 PAX（客运）概念飞机的推进系统架构和子系统技术选择。工作结果表明，通过结合超导电力网络和电机驱动系统，GKN Aerospace在氢电燃料推进系统集成方面的发展速度将比最初预想地更快。该公司提出，使用机载液态氢作为导电系统散热器，从而显著降低电阻率，有助于进行电力分配，进而将电缆和电动机的效率提高到99%以上。据悉，上述计划有望于2025年开展，首架超导氢动力飞机最早可于2035年投入使用。
法国空客公司宣布其跨国研发计划“明日之翼”（WOT）已成功交付首个全尺寸机翼演示器，这能促进下一代机翼技术进一步成熟化。第一台全复合材料机翼演示机的完成意味着其成功集成了100多种部件制造技术，其中包括全新工业装配系统，从而有助于验证关键的自动化指标。
中英货运无人机开发商Dronamics与澳大利亚最大的航空复合材料企业Quickstep Holdings Ltd.正在加速制造“黑天鹅”货运无人机，首批产品将于2023年上市，未来长期目标是在四年内每年增加数百架的产量。
美国Supernal在航展上展示了五座客舱概念，其设计中体现了仿生学、安全环保、以人为本等公司理念，公司希望2028年通过eVTOL车辆的欧盟认证。
英国政府计划在未来五年内开发一种新型飞行战斗演示机，该项目于2018年启动。目前，该项目正在开发复合材料和增材制造技术，以生产轻质、耐高温的密集型装置，并有望于2035年投入到下一代空中作战技术、工具研究过程当中。

源标题: 2022 Farnborough International Air Show highlights
原文:
Farnborough, as usual, provided a platform for a variety of announcements in the aerospace, defense and advanced air mobility spaces from companies like GKN Aerospace, Joby, Airbus, Rolls-Royce, Boom Supersonic and others.
The biennial Farnborough International Airshow (FIA), a trade exhibition for the aerospace and defense industries, took place this week, July 18-22, 2022, in Farnborough, U.K. This was the first Farnborough show since 2018 and has served as a litmus test for how the post-COVID world is evolving for commercial aerospace, space, defense, sustainability, innovation, future flight and workforce development. Below is an aggregation of some of news announced throughout the show that has relevance to the composites industry.
Bringing electric propulsion, hydrogen to AAM
Rolls-Royce (London, U.K.) and Hyundai Motor Group (Seoul, South Korea) announced plans at the 2022 Farnborough International Airshow to collaborate to bring all-electric propulsion and hydrogen fuel cell technology to the advanced air mobility (AAM) market. The partnership will leverage Rolls-Royce’s aviation and certification capabilities and Hyundai Motor Group’s hydrogen fuel cell technologies and industrialization capability.
The companies say the benefits of using a hydrogen fuel cell system in an all-electric aircraft propulsion system is that it is a zero-emission, silent and reliable on-board power source that enables scalability in power offerings as well as long distance flight range. Hyundai will work with Rolls-Royce to bring hydrogen fuel cells, storage systems and infrastructure to the aerospace markets, and advance this technology into Hyundai’s RAM Vehicles and Rolls-Royce’s all-electric and hybrid-electric propulsion system offerings.
Urban air mobility U.K. certification
Joby Aviation (Santa Cruz, Calif., U.S.), announced that it has formally applied for its electric vertical takeoff and landing (eVTOL) aircraft design to be certified for use in the U.K. While Joby is currently pursuing type certification (TC) for its aircraft with the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) and expects the U.S. to be its first operating market, this application will enable Joby’s U.S.-based certification to be concurrently validated by the U.K.’s Civil Aviation Authority (CAA), accelerating the company’s path to market in the U.K. Joby is believed to be the first eVTOL company to apply for foreign validation of its FAA TC.
U.K. Advanced Mobility Ecosystem Consortium
U.K.-based Vertical Aerospace (Bristol), Virgin Atlantic (Crawley), Atkins (Epsom), Skyports (London) and air traffic control service provider NATS, along with Connected Places Catapult and leading academic institutions, Cranfield University and WMG, University of Warwick, have announced the creation of the Advanced Mobility Ecosystem Consortium. Together, over two years, the organizations will develop key technology and infrastructure in a project that will significantly accelerate the introduction of AAM in the U.K. This will include creating and testing technological developments in aircraft electrification, airspace management, ground infrastructure, operating procedures, and the systems and supporting business cases required to implement a new model of aerial passenger transport in the region.
“The project will demonstrate the feasibility of a U.K. AAM ecosystem using Vertical Aerospace’s emission-free VX4 eVTOL aircraft, operated by Virgin Atlantic. Two physical flights will take place between Bristol Airport to an airfield in South West England, and between London Heathrow Airport and the Living Lab vertiport. A third simulation flight will demonstrate urban connectivity between London City and Bristol airports,” according to the original press release.
Read the full report here.
New variants for VX4 aircraft
Vertical Aerospace (Bristol, U.K.), is partnering with Babcock International (London, U.K.), an aerospace, defense and security company, to explore new applications for its VX4 eVTOL aircraft. Capable of traveling distances of more than 100 miles, achieving top of speeds of 200+ miles per hour with low noise, the aircraft has reportedly proven demand in the passenger transportation markets from established airline customers including Virgin Atlantic, aircraft lessors such as Avolon (Dublin, Ireland), and helicopter and tourism operators such as Bristow (Dyce, U.K.) and Iberojet (Palma, Spain).
Additional applications to be explored by Vertical Aerospace and Babcock International include aerial EMS and cargo transportation. Both companies will also work to develop modular maintenance, repair and overhaul (MRO) capabilities to enable cost-effective maintenance of the aircraft in remote and challenging environments and maximize availability.
Strategic partnership between Lilium and Bristow
Bristow Group Inc. (Houston, Texas, U.K.), a provider of sustainable vertical flight solutions, and Lilium N.V. (Munich, Germany), a developer of eVTOL aircraft, announced at the 2022 Farnborough International Airshow a strategic partnership where Bristow will have the option to purchase 50 Lilium Jets in addition to providing maintenance services for the Lilium Jet’s launch network in Florida, and other future U.S and European markets.
The non-binding Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) outlines collaboration between Bristow and Lilium on the development of a maintenance program to support the operation of the Lilium Jet, including the ramp-up of maintenance in support of the Lilium Jet’s entry into service (EIS) and post-EIS services. The MOU also enables Bristow to become an authorized service provider for Lilium. The MOU further outlines how Lilium and Bristow may collaborate on the process to achieve the relevant regulatory approvals for operating the Lilium Jet in Florida, and plans for Bristow to purchase 50 Lilium Jets.
Air taxi regulations
The European Union Aviation Safety Agency (EASA) announced publication of proposed rules for the operation of air taxis in cities, the first comprehensive proposal for such regulations to be issued worldwide. The agency notes that “the proposed new regulatory framework is open to public consultation until September 30, 2022, and cover the technical domains of airworthiness, air operations, flight crew licensing and rules of the air,” complementing existing EU regulatory material for operations of unmanned aircraft systems (UAS), the unmanned traffic management system known in Europe as U-space and the certification of aircraft capable of VTOL, as well as EASA guidance on the design of vertiports. It also is said to address general societal concerns and the expectations of EU citizens with respect to safety, security, privacy, environment and noise. Certain future developments (e.g., VTOL-capable aircraft without a human pilot on board) are not yet covered in this proposal, but will be addressed by EASA with separate proposals when needed and in line with technological progress.
Read the full article here.
Open fan engine architecture
Airbus (Toulouse, France) and CFM International (Cincinnati, Ohio, U.S.), a 50/50 joint company between GE Aviation (Cincinnati) and Safran Aircraft Engines (Courcouronnes, France), are collaborating to flight test CFM’s cutting-edge open fan engine architecture, with carbon fiber-reinforced polymer (CFRP) blades as key part of design. 
The joint demonstration program will use shared flight test assets. The plan is for CFM to perform engine ground tests, along with flight test validation, at GE Aviation’s Flight Test Operations center in Victorville, Calif., U.S. A second phase of flight tests will be performed from the Airbus flight test facility in Toulouse, France, in the second half of the decade. For these tests, the open fan engine will be mounted under the wing of a specially configured and instrumented A380 testbed aircraft.
The joint Airbus and CFM objectives for the open fan joint demonstration on the A380 are extensive. Read the full article here.
Supersonic flight updates
Overture aircraft rendering.
Overture aircraft rendering. Photo Credit: Boom Supersonic
Boom Supersonic (Denver, Colo., U.S.) revealed at Farnborough the latest design iteration of the company’s Overture aircraft. Carrying 65-80 passengers at twice the speed of today’s airliners and running on 100% sustainable aviation fuel (SAF), Overture will fly Mach 1.7 over water with a range of 4,250 nautical miles. Features of the modified design include four engines to reduce noise and operating costs, a fuselage that is larger in diameter at the front than the back to increase efficiency, gull wings to improve handling and carbon fiber construction to reduce weight and meet design contour requirements.
Additionally, Boom Supersonic announced that it will begin outfitting a new 70,000-square-foot hardware ground test facility in Centennial, Colo., to house its first full-scale Overture testing model and flight deck simulators. Earlier this year, Boom announced its selection of the Piedmont Triad area in North Carolina, U.S., for its first Overture Superfactory and remains on track to begin production in 2024. Finally, Boom reported a new partnering agreement with Northrop Grumman to develop special-mission variants of Overture.
Hydrogen-electric propulsion program milestones
GKN Aerospace (Bristol, U.K.) reported at Farnborough that its H2GEAR hydrogen-electric propulsion program has passed a major milestone by completing its first round of system-level trade studies. The studies focused on propulsion system architecture and subsystem technology selection for hypothetical 19, 48 and 96 PAX (passenger) concept aircraft. Work to date shows that GKN Aerospace’s developments in the fuel cell system integration, combined with hyperconducting power network and motor drive systems, will enable hydrogen electric propulsion to be scaled up more quickly than originally thought.
The hyperconducting systems proposed by GKN Aerospace use the onboard liquid hydrogen as a heat sink, cooling the electrical conductors to temperatures less than -200°C to dramatically reduce their electrical resistivity. This facilitates electrical power distribution at low voltage, lower-mass conducting cables and electric motors that are set to achieve over 99% efficiency. Unlike superconducting systems, which exhibit zero electrical resistance, a hyperconducting system would use more conventional conductor materials and is deliverable sooner, offering a greater overall impact on global emissions in the foreseeable future.
Integrated ground-based demonstration of the H2GEAR technologies is scheduled for 2025; entry-into-service of the first hyperconducting hydrogen-powered aircraft could be as early as 2035.
Wing of Tomorrow prototype assembly completed
Airbus (Tolouse, France) announced at the 2022 Farnborough International Airshow that its transnational R&T program, Wing of Tomorrow (WOT), has successfully delivered a first full-size wing demonstrator that will help mature next-generation wing technologies. The completion of the first of three fully composite wing demonstrators marks the integration of more than 100 component and manufacturing technologies that include an all-new industrial assembly system, and which have helped validate key automation targets. The wing includes many applications of innovative composites M&P, including thermoplastic ribs, an OOA VBO rear spar, infused skins, newly designed leading edge spars and more. The new build philosophy on WOT also eradicates in-tank working and enables manual and automated assembly to be smoothly integrated into an optimized industrial system.

Middle-mile cargo delivery drones
Dronamics (Sofia, Bulgaria), a middle-mile cargo drone developer and operator, and Quickstep Holdings Ltd. (New South Wales, Australia), a Tier One manufacturer and the largest independent aerospace composites business in Australia, are working together to accelerate the production of the European company’s Black Swan cargo drones. With the first units landing in 2023, Dronamics and Quickstep’s long-term plan targets the ramp-up of production of hundreds of Black Swan cargo drones annually in the next four years.
Read the full announcement here.
eVTOL cabin concept unveiled
Photo Credit: Supernal, Hyundai Motor Group
Supernal (Washington, D.C., U.S.) revealed its initial electric vertical takeoff and landing (eVTOL) vehicle cabin concept at Farnborough International Airshow, providing the first look at how Hyundai Motor Group (Seoul, South Korea) is integrating automotive capabilities to develop the advanced air mobility (AAM) market.
Supernal’s five-seat cabin concept design embodies biomimicry — a butterfly in this case — and the company’s pillars of safety, human-centered design and environmental responsibility. With sustainability as a priority, the cabin concept incorporates materials such as advanced recyclable carbon fiber-reinforced thermoplastic (CFRTP), durable plant-based leather, recycled plastic fabric and responsibly sourced woods. Supernal hopes to certify its eVTOL vehicle for commercial use in the U.S. starting in 2028, with the E.U. and U.K. following soon after. Read the full announcement here.
U.K. lays out plans for next-generation combat aircraft
The U.K. Secretary of State for Defence, Ben Wallace MP, has confirmed plans for Britain to lead the development of a new flying combat air demonstrator — to fly within the next five years — which will play a critical role in the delivery of the region’s Future Combat Air System, Tempest.
Launched in 2018, the flagship project is part of a suite of novel technologies being developed by Team Tempest, involving a number of suppliers — led by BAE Systems (Farnborough) — and the Ministry of Defence. These concepts are designed to demonstrate and test the next generation combat air skills, tools, processes and techniques needed to ensure Tempest enters service in 2035. The project, for example, is developing composite materials and additive manufacturing (AM) to produce lightweight, power-dense configurations capable of operating at higher temperatures.

源标题: F-35 May Destroy Enemy ICBMs
原文:
F-35 weapons and sensors will detect or destroy an ICBM launch during the initial “boost” phase
KRIS OSBORN, WARRIOR MAVEN - CENTER FOR MILITARY MODERNIZATION
· OCT 9, 2022
by Kris Osborn, President, Center for Military Modernization
(Washington D.C.) The Pentagon is working with industry to explore the possibility that bomb, missile or laser-armedF-35scould destroy an attacking nuclear-armed Intercontinental Ballistic Missile (ICBM) targeting the US, potentially bringing a new dimension to existing defenses.
F-35s & ICBMs
The concept, according to industry and Pentagon developers, would be to useF-35weapons and sensors to detect or destroy an ICBM launch during its initial “boost” phase of upward flight toward the boundary of the earth’s atmosphere. TheF-35could use a “kinetic” solution wherein it fires upon and destroys a launchingICBM-- or a “sensor” solution where it “cues missile defense systems.”
While PentagonF-35officials emphasize the F-35 program is currently focused on nearer-term efforts such as delivering software upgrades to the airplane, there is growing consensus that exploringF-35nuclear missile defense is something of great potential benefit. Early conversations and conceptual work are already underway.
The prospect of using anF-35for this purpose introduces a range of defensive possibilities not yet part of the Pentagon’s missile defense arsenal. For instance, an F-35 could fire air-to-ground bombs or missiles to expode an ICBM or even use lasers and electronic warfare to incinerate, jam or disable the flight trajectory of an attackingICBM. If an ICBM guidance system, or propulsion mechanisms were interfered with, an ICBM might be thrown off, heading into the ocean or an uninhabited area less likely to cause damage.
Also, a group of F-35s could potentially form some kind of networked “relay system” using the Multi-function Advanced Data Link (MADL) to deliver threat information across a fleet of aircraft in position to warn US missile defense systems. This MADL data link, which enables a group ofF-35sto all see the same thing in real-time while conducting a mission, could potentially extend the range of systems able to find or detect an enemyICBM. It goes without saying that the earlier Combatant Commanders and decision-makers learn of an attacking ICBM, the more time they have to consider and implement countermeasures or launch a counterattack.
Many ICBM launch points developed by potential adversaries are lodged deep inland and heavily defended by air-defenses, making them harder for certain weapons and attack assets to reach.
Also, a 2014 Congressional Report, the US-China Economic and Security Review, contained a 70-page chapter on Chinese military modernization. Among its many findings, the report specifically cited Chinese “mobile”ICBMlaunchers with as many as 10 “reentry vehicles” in some cases. These weapons, of course, present significant new threats; the more reentry vehicles approaching a target, the more difficult the defense. With this in mind, an F-35 might bring an ability to use stealth, speed and maneuverability to operate above heavily defended inland areas to find, chase and destroy mobile launchers,
The initial launch or “boost” phase of an ICBM, it appears, would present the best opportunity for anF-35to have the intended missile-defense impact. Hitting an ICBM attack during the final, or “terminal” phase would present challenges due to the number of reentry vehicles. All of this raises the question as to whether anF-35could be part of an integrated system able to detect and knock out enemy ICBMswhile they are traveling in space. While difficult, it might someday be possible for an F-35 to use GPS or other air-mounted sensors to interact with satellites - which themselves could fire lasers or some kind of interceptor to hit an ICBM during space flight. In this scenario, an F-35 would function as a sensor or networked “node” and not an actual attacker, per se.
AnF-35would bring something new to missile defense by potentially filing a needed niche or, at very least, greatly supplementing existing land-based systems. Unlike offensive nuclear deterrents such as air, sea and land weapons, US ICBM missile defense weapons are primarily land-based. A Ground Based Interceptor (GBI), for instance, stationed in Ft. Greely, Alaska or Vandenberg AFB, Calf., would fire up into space during an ICBMs mid-course phase of flight to intercept the attacking missile.
This presents a number of challenges, as GBIs need sensors or embedded technology enabling them to distinguish decoys from actual ICBMs. This is the reason for the Pentagon’s emerging Next Generation Interceptor, a technology designed to both detect and destroy multiple incoming missiles or decoys traveling through space. Multiple Kill Vehicle, as it sounds, integrates a number of interceptors onto one missile; numerous decoys flying alongside an ICBM can increase the chances that an actual nuclear weapon will continue on to its target. For this reason, sensors are being developed and designed to discriminate, or distinguish decoys from missiles.
Regardless, identifying and knocking out large numbers of ICBMs is, by any estimation, a challenge. A single launch, from a rogue state such as North Korea only able to launch one or two ICBMs at most, presents a much more manageable threat for ground-based interceptors. An incoming salvo of ICBMs, by contrast, is a different equation. This leads to two strategies; the first would be an offensive deterrent using the US nuclear triad to stop a first strike from ever happening by ensuring a catastrophic retaliation -- and the second would encompass a range of ongoing technologically advanced defensive measures including things like satellites, lasers, Multiple Kill-Vehicles orF-35s.
Destroying ICBMs is something quite different than tracking or intercepting a short or medium range ballistic missile. The F-35 is already developed in this capacity; the F-35 has been tested as an aerial node for the Navy’s Naval Integrated Fire Control - Counter Air system. This technology, now deployed, uses ship-based Aegis radar, an aerial sensor node and a guided SM-6 missile to knock out attacking missiles from ranges beyond-the-horizon. Since its inception, NIFC-CA used an E-2 Hawkeye surveillance plane as the aerial node. Now, the system can use a far more capable F-35 as the aerial sensor.

中文标题: 以色列成功试验箭-3导弹防御系统
整编内容:
当地时间2022年1月18日凌晨，以色列导弹防御组织（IMDO）在中部成功开展箭-3系统反导试验。试验中，雷达阵列探测到目标并将数据发送到火控系统，火控系统分析数据并规划拦截方案，拦截方案生成后发射两枚拦截弹，沿两条不同弹道拦截同一个目标。
以色列国防部导弹防御组织负责人称，本次试验验证了箭-3系统探测雷达、发射装置和拦截弹等多项“突破性”能力。箭-3系统制造商以色列航空航天工业公司（IAI）表示，最重大的突破在算法领域，即系统探测来袭威胁并计算拦截弹弹道的方式，但拒绝透露具体细节。以色列国防部武器开发和技术基础设施管理局局长丹尼·戈尔德将认为此次试验“代表了国防机构更新和应对地区和未来战场上新兴威胁能力的技术突破”。
近期，伊朗开展了多次弹道导弹试验。以色列国防部长本尼甘茨表示，箭-3系统试验确保了以色列自由采取行动的能力。

源标题: Israel successfully tests Arrow 3 anti-ballistic missile system
原文:
Defense Ministry says radar arrays detected incoming ‘target’ and two Arrow 3 interceptors were fired at it, destroying it; trial follows recent Iranian ballistic missile tests
By JUDAH ARI GROSS 
18 January 2022, 6:47 amUpdated at 9:36 am
Israel conducted a successful test of its Arrow 3 anti-ballistic missile system on Tuesday morning outside the Earth’s atmosphere, the Defense Ministry said.
The trial tested a number of “breakthrough” capabilities for the missile defense system, which can be used immediately by the Israeli Air Force, the Defense Ministry’s Missile Defense Organization head Moshe Patel told reporters on Tuesday.
“We have made a breakthrough in every part of the system, in the detection arrays, in the launches, even in the interceptors themselves, so that they match the threats that are expected in the region. There were highly, highly significant technological breakthroughs here that were assessed and can be used by the air force in its operational systems immediately,” Patel said.
Boaz Levy, the president and CEO of the Israel Aerospace Industries, which manufactures the Arrow 3, said the breakthroughs were principally in the area of “algorithms,” the ways in which the systems detect incoming threats and calculate launch trajectories for interceptors.
“I won’t elaborate, but it gives the system more capabilities in dealing with threats,” Levy told reporters.
The live-fire test was held over central Israel in the early hours of Tuesday morning, with two Arrow 3 interceptors being fired at the same target.
“The operational radar arrays of the Arrow system detected the target and sent the data to the fire management system, which analyzed the data and fully plotted the interception. Once the plans were completed, two Arrow 3 interceptors were fired at the target, and they completed their mission successfully,” the Defense Ministry said in a statement.
Two Arrow 3 interceptors are launched during a test of the missile defense system on January 18, 2022. (Defense Ministry)
Levy said the launching of two interceptors was intentional and planned in advance, not the result of one failing to shoot down the incoming simulated target. He said the two interceptors had “two different missions” in the exercise, having been given two different flight paths to shoot down the same target. “They were carried out exactly as we planned them,” Levy added.
Patel added that this more closely matches what would happen in an actual barrage and is the first time that two interceptors were launched simultaneously. He refused to comment on the precise altitude at which the interceptors shot down the target, but said it was “deep in space.”
The Arrow 3 is currently Israel’s most advanced long-range missile defense system, meant to intercept ballistic missiles while they are still outside of the Earth’s atmosphere, taking out projectiles and their nuclear, biological, chemical or conventional warheads closer to their launch sites. It was developed in a joint project between the Defense Ministry’s Missile Defense Organization and the American Missile Defense Agency. Work is underway on the development of a yet more advanced system, the Arrow 4.
The head of the Defense Ministry’s Weapons Development and Technology Infrastructure Administration, Danny Gold, described the test as “a breakthrough that represents a technological leap forward in the capabilities of the defense establishment to renew and to match the emerging threats regionally and on the future battlefield.”
Tuesday’s test followed a number of recent ballistic missile tests by Iran in recent weeks.
In an apparent threat to Iran, Defense Minister Benny Gantz said the Arrow test ensured Israel’s ability to take action freely.
“We are preserving Israel’s ability to defend itself against developing threats in the region and allowing Israel offensive freedom of operation against its enemies, from an understanding that the best defense allows for the most effective attack,” he said.
Tuesday’s test was apparently delayed multiple times, likely due to inclement weather, with the testing area off the coast of central Israel being closed to commercial flights twice over the past week. Patel refused to comment on the reason behind these postponements, saying only that certain safety criteria had not been met.
The Arrow 3 was first tested successfully in February 2018, after months of delays and technical problems. It is considered one of the most powerful weapons of its kind in the world and has been in development since 2008.
Complemented by a number of other missile defense systems designed to protect Israel from short-, medium- and long-range attacks, the Arrow 3 represents the highest level of Israel’s multi-tiered missile defense network.
中文原文: 国防部说，雷达阵列探测到来袭的“目标”，两枚箭3拦截器向其发射，摧毁了它；伊朗最近试射弹道导弹后进行试射作者：犹大·阿里·格罗斯2022年1月18日6:47-上午9:36更新以色列国防部称，周二上午，以色列在地球大气层外成功进行了箭3反弹道导弹系统试验。国防部导弹防御组织负责人摩西·帕特尔（Moshe Patel）周二对记者表示，这次试验测试了导弹防御系统的一些“突破性”能力，以色列空军可以立即使用这些能力。“我们在系统的每个部分都取得了突破，在探测阵列中，在发射中，甚至在拦截器本身中，使它们与该地区预期的威胁相匹配。帕特尔说：“这里有非常非常重要的技术突破，经过评估，空军可以立即在其作战系统中使用。”制造箭3的以色列航空航天工业公司的总裁兼首席执行官波阿斯·利维（Boaz Levy）表示，这些突破主要在“算法”领域，即系统检测来袭威胁和计算拦截器发射轨迹的方式。利维告诉记者：“我不会详细说明，但它赋予了系统更多应对威胁的能力。”实弹测试于周二凌晨在以色列中部举行，两枚箭3拦截弹向同一目标发射。“箭系统的作战雷达阵列探测到目标，并将数据发送到火力管理系统，火力管理系统分析数据并全面绘制拦截图。国防部在一份声明中说：“一旦计划完成，两枚箭3拦截器就向目标发射，它们成功地完成了任务。”2022年1月18日，两枚箭3拦截器在导弹防御系统测试中发射。（国防部）利维说，发射两枚拦截弹是故意的，是事先计划好的，而不是一枚未能击落来袭模拟目标的结果。他说，这两个拦截器在演习中有“两个不同的任务”，被赋予两条不同的飞行路线来击落同一个目标。“他们完全按照我们的计划进行，”利维补充道。帕特尔补充说，这更符合实际弹幕中会发生的情况，也是第一次同时发射两枚拦截弹。他拒绝就拦截器击落目标的精确高度发表评论，但表示目标“在太空深处”。箭3是目前以色列最先进的远程导弹防御系统，旨在拦截仍在地球大气层外的弹道导弹，在靠近发射场的地方取出炮弹及其核、生物、化学或常规弹头。它是在国防部导弹防御组织和美国导弹防御局的一个联合项目中开发的。一个更先进的系统，箭4的开发工作正在进行中。国防部武器发展和技术基础设施管理局局长丹尼·戈尔德（Danny Gold）将这次试验描述为“一项突破，代表了国防机构更新和应对地区和未来战场上新出现的威胁的能力的技术飞跃。”周二的试验是在伊朗最近几周进行了几次弹道导弹试验之后进行的。国防部长本尼·甘茨（Benny Gantz）表示，箭的试验确保了以色列自由采取行动的能力，这显然是对伊朗的威胁。他说：“我们正在维护以色列抵御该地区不断发展的威胁的能力，并允许以色列对其敌人采取进攻性行动的自由，因为我们理解，最好的防御允许最有效的攻击。”周二的测试显然被多次推迟，可能是由于恶劣的天气，以色列中部沿海的测试区在过去一周两次对商业航班关闭。帕特尔拒绝对这些推迟背后的原因发表评论，只是说某些安全标准没有得到满足。经过数月的延迟和技术问题，箭3号于2018年2月首次成功测试。它被认为是世界上同类武器中最强大的武器之一，自2008年以来一直在开发中。箭3是以色列多层导弹防御网络的最高水平，配合其他一些旨在保护以色列免受短程、中程和远程攻击的导弹防御系统。

中文标题: 莱茵金属公司与通用汽车防务公司联合竞标美陆军通用战术卡车项目
整编内容:
美国莱茵金属汽车公司和通用汽车防务公司8月17日宣布，联手竞标美国陆军价值50亿美元的通用战术卡车项目。
美国陆军计划用通用战术卡车取代重型战术卡车系列，并将通过快速原型制造来加快装备采办。美国陆军作战支援与作战勤务支援项目执行办公室负责管理通用战术卡车项目竞标工作，计划在12月授予项目第一阶段合同。美国陆军将以约50亿美元的价格采购5700辆通用战术卡车。
美国莱茵金属汽车公司和通用汽车防务公司计划利用莱茵金属的HX3系列卡车参与项目第一阶段竞标。与早期的HX系列卡车相比，HX3系列卡车增加了发动机功率、机动性和先进的驾驶员辅助系统，采用开放式系统架构，允许车辆未来集成混合动力技术、“引导-跟随”驾驶技术和自主技术。两家公司的合作伙伴关系将把莱茵金属公司在重型地面车辆方面的成熟经验与通用汽车防务公司的商业创新技术结合起来，提高通用战术卡车的性能、技术水平和竞争力。2022年初，通用汽车公司宣布将投资350亿美元用于车辆电气化和自主技术开发。

源标题: American Rheinmetall and GM Defense will work together on the first phase of the Army's Common Tactical Truck program.
原文:
By ANDREW EVERSDEN
on August 17, 2022
at 2:18 PM
American Rheinmetall Vehicles and GM Defense are offering the U.S. Army the HX3-CTT, a derivative of the HX3 (pictured in front 3/4 view on gravel), in response to the first phase of the Army’s Common Tactical Truck program. (Courtesy of American Rheinmetall)
WASHINGTON — American Rheinmetall Vehicles andGM Defensehave teamed up to compete for the US Army’smulti-billion dollar Common Tactical Truckaward, the companies announced today.
The Army is planning to replace its Family of Heavy Tactical Trucks with the Common Tactical Truck and plans to userapid prototypingto accelerate the acquisition timeline.
The Army’s Program Executive Office for Combat Support and Combat Service Support is managing the competition and plans to make an award in December. Anews releasefrom the companies says the request for prototype proposals was released in late June. The Army could buy up to 5,700 vehicles for about $5 billion.
According to the release, the companies plan to offerRheinmetall’sHX3-series truck for the first phase of the competition, and use it as a “starting point” for technology-driven collaboration. The HX3 trucks have increased power, mobility and advanced driver assistance systems compared to earlier generations of HX trucks, the release stated. The trucks are also built with an open systems architecture that the companies say will allow for future integration of of hybrid technology, leader-follower driving and autonomous operations.
“American Rheinmetall Vehicles is a committed partner to the Army, bringing next-generation capability, technology and competition to high priority Army modernization programs like CTT,” said Matthew Warnick, managing director for American Rheinmetall Vehicles, in a news release. “GM Defense shares our commitment, and together our team will provide a transformational truck to support the Army and its Soldiers.”
The partnership will pair Rheinmetall’s well-established experience in heavy ground vehicles with the commercial innovation GM Defense can access to through its parent company, General Motors. For example, General Motors announced earlier this year that it is investing$35 billionin electrification and autonomy technology.
GM Defense re-launched its defense business in 2017 after a 14-year hiatus. The company relies on its parent company’s experience in the commercial automotive sector to set itself apart from other military-focused contractors. In 2020 it won the Army’sInfantry Squad Vehiclecontest. The partnership also allows GM Defense to continue to expand its footprint in the defense sector.

中文标题: 美军反无人机系统与导弹系统集成取得进展
情报来源: 美国空军和太空军杂志网站
整编内容: 美国中央司令部计划将空中力量、导弹和无人机防御系统集成，现已经取得一定进展，但要完全实现单屏一体化显示，还有很多工作要做。中央司令部副司令格里高利·M·吉洛特中将吉洛特表示，美军希望形成一种综合且分层的空中和导弹防御能力，可以应对包括上层装备到小型无人机以及其间的一切空中威胁。空军中央司令亚历克斯·格林科维奇中将负责中央司令部地区的弹道导弹防御和载人防空。单个基地指挥官负责小型无人机防空，格林科维奇和基地指挥官共同负责大型无人机防空。由于有众多指挥官负责追踪空中威胁，美军希望能够共享数据以及协调指挥，计划将所有不同系统的信息整合到一块屏幕上，使指挥官们能够在导弹防御区感知态势。特别是针对反无人机任务，美军正试图通过使用该地区已有的系统来增加感知能力。通过将更多的传感器连接在一起，从预警雷达到地基雷达，再到只为对抗无人机而设计的非常小的探测系统，将它们集成到同一块屏幕上，向指挥官提供统一的视图。中央司令部拥有微波和定向能武器等实验技术，以应对无人机威胁，并正在重新利用现有系统，如反火箭、炮兵、迫击炮拦截。（航空工业信息中心 高俊杰 供稿 刘天易 审核）

源标题: CENTCOM Sees Success with Integrated Anti-Drone and Missile Defenses
原文:
2023-1-17
U.S. Central Command is making progress tying together air, missile, and drone defenses—but there’s still more to be done to achieve “single-pane-of-glass” integration, officials say. 
Fully integrating sensors and defenses will demand further innovations, both in integrating new technologies and repurposing existing ones, said CENTCOM Deputy Commander Lt. Gen. Gregory M. Guillot in a virtual discussion Jan. 17 hosted by the Missile Defense Advocacy Alliance. 
“What I focus on … is advocating for a layered, integrated air and missile defense capability, from the upper tier all the way down to counter-small UAS—a quadcopter flying 50 to 100 feet off the ground at 10 or 20 miles an hour—and everything in between,” Guillot said. 
Air Forces Central commander Lt. Gen. Alexus G. Grynkewich is responsible for ballistic missile defense and manned air defense in the CENTCOM region, Guillot noted. Individual base commanders are responsible for smaller drones, and Grynkewich and base commanders share responsibility for larger drones. 
With so many commanders tasked with tracking airborne threats, the goal has been to unite and share data, Guillot said. 
“The way we look to that … is to bring all these different systems that give a commander situational awareness in the missile defense area onto a single pane of glass,” Guillot explained. “And we’re not there yet. We used to be in three or four, maybe five or more buildings on a base with different systems separated. We now have all of the systems in one room—now sometimes it’s on five or six different screens—but all the feeds are at least coming into one room so that the commander can make timely decisions. 
“We’re working to innovate to get it all into one pane of glass [on which] everybody can share all their information.” 
Innovation has become a focus for CENTCOM leaders, driven by commander Gen. Michael “Erik” Kurilla and a need to do more with less, given that U.S. military strategy and resources have shifted away from the region. And while that push has included experimentation with low-cost drones through the Air Force’s Task Force 99, it’s also required responses to counter Iranian-backed militias, which have launched attacks using explosives strapped to low-cost commercial drones. 
“If you’ve got an Amazon card and access to a hand grenade, you’ve now got an over-the-horizon weapon capability,” said Rear Adm. Curt Renshaw, director of operations for CENTCOM.
Guillot said such weapons pose a “daily threat.” In September, a USAF F-15 shot down an Iranian drone believed to be a threat to U.S. forces in Iraq. 
Moving forward, Guillot said, the goal is to ensure commanders have the time and options needed to match their response to the threat. 
“I think I would always want more sensing—not necessarily better sensing, and I wouldn’t say that it’s a vulnerability in any way. We have a lot a lot of good sensors,” Guillot said. “But the earlier and the further out you can sense anything gives you more time and more decision space to find the right asset to shoot it down, whether it’s an air-to-air fighter, all the way down to a kinetic or a non-kinetic capability at a base.” 
Specifically for the counter-UAS mission, officials are trying to increase sensing by using systems already in the region. 
“We’re looking at how do you tune radars to see smaller, slower? And how do you tune these systems to get after the smaller radar cross section type of capabilities at further distances?” said Army Maj. Gen. Sean A. Gainey, director of the Joint C-UAS Office. 
More sensing will also come from tying more sensors together to present a unified view to commanders, Guillot said. 
“We’re doing a really good job of tying everything from AWACS radars to ground-based radars to very small systems that are designed only for the counter-UAS roles, tying them all into that single pane of glass that I mentioned,” Guillot said. 
CENTCOM has experimental technologies like microwave and directed energy weapons to counter UAS threats, and they are repurposing existing systems, such as the Counter-Rocket, Artillery, Mortar (C-RAM) Intercept. 
With the push to innovate and expand capabilities, CENTCOM is helping to lead the way on a new approach to counter-UAS, Gainey said. 
“You can’t look at this fight as a counter-UAS fight and as an integrated air and missile defense fight,” Gainey said. “You’ve got to look at it holistically as an integrated air and missile defense fight.”
中文原文: 2023-1-17官员们说，美国中央司令部在将空中、导弹和无人机防御结合起来方面取得了进展，但要实现“单一玻璃”的集成，还有更多工作要做。中央司令部副司令格雷戈里·吉洛中将（Gregory M.Guillot）在1月17日由导弹防御倡导联盟主办的一次虚拟讨论中表示，充分整合传感器和防御将需要进一步的创新，包括整合新技术和重新利用现有技术。吉尔洛说：“我关注的是……倡导分层、一体化的空中和导弹防御能力，从上层一直到反小型无人机--一种以每小时10或20英里的速度离地50至100英尺的四分机--以及两者之间的一切。”Guillot指出，空军中央指挥官Alexus G.Grynkewich中将负责中央司令部地区的弹道导弹防御和载人防空。单个基地指挥官负责较小的无人机，Grynkewich和基地指挥官共同负责较大的无人机。Guillot说，由于有如此多的指挥官负责跟踪空中威胁，目标是团结和共享数据。“我们对此的看法是……将所有这些不同的系统带到一块玻璃上，让指挥官在导弹防御区了解情况，”吉尔洛解释说。“我们还没有到那一步。我们曾经在一个基地的三四个，也许五个或更多的建筑里，不同的系统被分开。我们现在把所有的系统都放在一个房间里--现在有时它在五六个不同的屏幕上--但所有的馈源至少都进入了一个房间，这样指挥官就可以及时做出决定。“我们正在努力创新，将所有信息都放在一块玻璃上，每个人都可以在上面分享他们的所有信息。”在指挥官迈克尔·埃里克·库里拉将军的推动下，创新已经成为中央司令部领导人的焦点，鉴于美国的军事战略和资源已经从该地区转移，需要少花钱多办事。虽然这一努力包括通过空军99特遣部队进行低成本无人机实验，但也需要做出回应来反击伊朗支持的民兵组织，这些民兵组织使用绑在低成本商业无人机上的炸药发动袭击。“如果你有亚马逊卡和手榴弹，你现在就有了超视距武器能力，”中央司令部运营总监科特·伦肖少将说。吉尔洛说，这种武器构成“每天的威胁”9月，一架美国空军F-15击落了一架被认为对驻伊拉克美军构成威胁的伊朗无人机。Guillot说，前进的目标是确保指挥官有足够的时间和选择来应对威胁。“我想我总是想要更多的感知--不一定是更好的感知，我也不会说这是一个弱点。我们有很多很多好的传感器，“吉尔洛说。“但你能感觉到的东西越早、越远，你就有更多的时间和更大的决策空间来找到合适的资产来击落它，无论是空对空战斗机，还是基地的动能或非动能。”特别是针对反无人机任务，官员们正试图通过使用该地区已经存在的系统来增加感知能力。“我们正在研究如何调整雷达，以看到更小、更慢的雷达？你如何调整这些系统，以在更远的距离上获得更小的雷达散射截面类型的能力？“C-UAS联合办公室主任陆军少将肖恩·A·盖尼说。Guillot说，更多的感知也将来自于将更多的传感器绑在一起，以向指挥官呈现统一的观点。Guillot说：“我们在把从预警机雷达到地基雷达的所有东西都绑定到只为反无人机角色设计的非常小的系统上，把它们都绑定在我提到的一块玻璃上，这方面做得非常好。”CENTCOM拥有微波和定向能武器等实验技术来对抗UAS的威胁，他们正在重新利用现有的系统，如反火箭、火炮、迫击炮（C-RAM）拦截。盖尼说，随着创新和扩大能力的推动，CENTCOM正在帮助引领反无人机的新方法。盖尼说：“你不能把这场战斗视为反无人机战斗，也不能视为综合空中和导弹防御战斗。”“你必须从整体上看，这是一场综合的空中和导弹防御战。”

中文标题: 通用原子公司在MQ-9B上试验普惠加拿大涡桨发动机
整编内容:
通用原子航空系统公司已经测试了普惠加拿大公司涡桨发动机PT6E，以作为MQ-9B “天空卫士”无人机的动力，并计划作为该机的第二个发动机选项。MQ-9B的标准动力是一台霍尼韦尔TPE331-10涡桨发动机。
通用原子公司16日表示，7月29日，公司在一架MQ-9上对PT6E涡桨发动机进行了“多次全功率发动机测试”。
通用原子公司总裁戴维·亚历山大表示：“将PT6E发动机集成到MQ-9B “天空卫士”飞机上，使功率增加了33%,提供了双通道电子螺旋桨和发动机控制系统，以及PT6发动机系列的所有优势。”
亚历山大指出，如果获得批准，PT6E可能是公司未来客户对MQ-9B的可选升级选项。
“天空卫士”和姊妹飞机“海上卫士”以及MQ-9A“收割者”属于同一系列的无人机，标准动力都是霍尼韦尔TPE331-10。MQ-9A也被称为MQ-1B“捕食者”,于2001年首飞，并在美国空军、英国皇家空军和法国空军中广泛使用。
英国皇家空军已经签署购买MQ-9B作为其现有MQ-9A“收割者”机队的替换机型，皇家空军是首个如此替换的空军。MQ-9B预计在2024年进入英国皇家空军服役，命名为“保护者”RG Mk1（Protector RG Mk1）。皇家空军计划将MQ-9B部署在林肯郡的沃丁顿基地，将成为MQ-9B的第一个用户。
MQ-9B在MQ-9A的基础上进行了几项重大升级，包括更大的有效载荷，9个武器或传感器吊舱挂点，更强的耐久性和用于水上任务（包括涉及反潜战任务）的专用海上配置，。通用原子公司表示，从早期的RQ-1“捕食者”开始的整个系列，飞行已超过700万飞行小时。
根据通用原子公司的介绍，普惠加拿大公司已经为通用原子公司的MQ-20“复仇者”提供PW545B涡扇发动机超过十年。MQ-20针对高速飞行设计，用于秘密监视和精确打击任务。
整编机构: 中国航空发动机研究院
源标题: General Atomics tests Pratt & Whitney turboprop engine on MQ-9B
原文:
General Atomics Aeronautical Systems has tested a Pratt & Whitney Canada turboprop as power for an MQ-9B SkyGuardian remotely piloted aircraft (RPA), with plans to offer the aircraft with a second engine option.
The San Diego manufacturer of unmanned aircraft performed “multiple full-power engine tests” of a P&WC PT6 E-Series turboprop on an MQ-9 on 29 July at its flight operations facility in El Mirage, California, General Atomics says on 16 August.
The MQ-9B’s standard power is a single Honeywell TPE331-10 turboprop. PT6s are among the best selling turboprops, being widely used on general aviation aircraft and small commercial aircraft.
“Integrating [the] PT6 E-Series engine onto our MQ-9B SkyGuardian aircraft offers…a 33% increase in power, dual channel electronic propeller and engine control system, as well as all the benefits of the PT6 engine family,” says David Alexander, General Atomics president.
Alexander notes that if approved, the PT6 powerplant could be an optional upgrade to the MQ-9B for the company’s future customers.
SkyGuardian and sister aircraft SeaGuardian are from the same line of RPAs as the MQ-9A Reaper, and all have the Honeywell powerplant as standard power. The Reaper, also known as the Predator B, first flew in 2001 and has seen extensive combat use with the US Air Force, UK Royal Air Force (RAF) and French air force.
The RAF has already signed to acquire the MQ-9B as a successor to its current fleet of MQ-9A Reapers, the first air force to do so. The RPA is expected to enter service with the RAF in 2024, under the designation Protector RG Mk1.
With plans to operate from RAF Waddington in Lincolnshire, the UK is set to become the first active user of the MQ-9B.
General Atomics describes the PT6 engine as a reliable and versatile turboprop that “will deliver the performance characteristics required as [General Atomics] continues its development of MQ-9B capabilities”.
The MQ-9B features several major upgrades from the Reaper, including more payload, nine hard points for weapons or sensor pods, greater endurance and a dedicated maritime configuration for over-water missions, including those involving anti-submarine warfare. General Atomics says the entire family of vehicles, which began with the early RQ-1 Predator, boasts more than 7 million flight hours.
Montreal-based P&WC has been producing the PW545B powerplant for General Atomics’ MQ-20 Avenger RPA for more than ten years, according to General Atomics.
The low-profile Avenger, also known as the Predator C, was designed around high flight speed for covert surveillance and precision-strike missions.

中文标题: IMEC研发出与平板显示器更兼容的pMUT阵列技术
整编内容: 近日，由比利时微电子研究中心（IMEC）领导的研究团队研发出一种与平板显示器（FPD）技术兼容的压电式微机械超声换能器（pMUT）阵列技术。该阵列的空中声压高于1 kPa，达到了实现空中触觉和定向声音的压力水平，可为智能系统提供触觉反馈。在实现空中触觉的情况下，超声波产生的局部压力场，能使用户在不接触物体的情况下“感觉”到光感。此外，新技术与FPD技术相兼容，可在200~400 kHz范围内的共振频率下工作，产生的峰值压力约为1.5 kPa，成功复制了硅晶圆平台的空中触觉反馈性能指标。该研究有望将pMUT技术融合到大型面板和显示器中，填补了大容量空中应用的低频、高压器件技术空白。
关键词: 平板显示器 pMUT阵列 超声波技术 空中触觉
整编机构: 国家工业信息安全发展研究中心
源标题: Imec develops pMUT array compatible with FPD technologies
原文:
Imec has developed a piezoelectric Micromachined Ultrasound Transducer (pMUT) array that is compatible with flat-panel-displays (FPD) process technologies.
The array demonstrates acoustic pressures in mid-air above 1kPa, a pressure level relevant for enabling mid-air haptics and directed sound.
Moving from wafer-based to FPD-compatible processes prepares the pMUT technology for the integration of future mid-air applications, such as vibro-haptics, time-of-flight (3D) sensing or gesture recognition, in novel form factors like smartphones and car dashboards.
This technology can be used to create touchless, interactive, screens in automotive and consumer applications, or used in gaming.
Ultrasound technology can be used to equip smart systems with haptic feedback, giving the user a sense of touch.
In the case of mid-air haptics, ultrasonic waves produce a local pressure field causing the user to ‘feel’ a light sensation without touching the object.
Such applications require high-pressures at low ultrasonic frequencies. Current solutions include, on the one hand, large standard piezoelectric elements that produce relatively high frequencies impeding a precise interaction with the user.
On the other hand, small silicon-based micromachined transducer arrays can enable haptic feedback at short distance in a small area only.
Imec’s FPD-compatible thin-film pMUT technology is inherently more compatible with display manufacturing techniques. As such, it paves the way to applications with unprecedented area and depth of experience.
Imec’s FPD-compatible thin-film pMUT array now fills the niche for low-frequency, high-pressure devices for large volume mid-air applications.
Peak pressures of ~1.5 kPa in air at resonant frequencies in the range of 200 to 400 kHz are demonstrated, replicating the performance metrics successfully demonstrated mid-air haptic feedback on its Si wafer-based platform.
“We currently offer wafer-level demonstrations of our FPD-technology and prototyping solutions for interested parties. Additionally, we are looking into partnerships for volume manufacturing on large-area panels and plates,” says Erwin Hijzen, Program Director MEMS Ultrasound at imec.
“The possibility to integrate our pMUT technology into large panels and displays is a key milestone in realization of our vision on large area sensor surfaces. We started with ultrasound transducers for in-body imaging and now moved to mid-air applications such as haptics.” concludes Xavier Rottenberg, Fellow Sensors and Actuators at imec.
中文原文: Imec开发了一种与平板显示器(FPD)工艺技术兼容的压电微机械超声换能器(pMUT)阵列。该阵列显示了超过1kPa的半空中声压，这是一个与实现半空中触觉和定向声音相关的压力水平。pMUT技术从基于晶圆的工艺转向与FPD兼容的工艺，为未来空中应用的集成做好了准备，如振动触觉、飞行时间(3D)传感或手势识别，以及智能手机和汽车仪表板等新颖的形式因素。这项技术可以用于在汽车和消费应用中创建无接触的交互式屏幕，或者用于游戏。超声波技术可以用来为智能系统配备触觉反馈，给用户一种触觉。在半空中触觉的情况下，超声波产生一个局部压力场，使用户在不接触物体的情况下“感受”光的感觉。这样的应用需要在低超声波频率下的高压。目前的解决方案包括，一方面，大的标准压电元件，其产生相对高的频率，妨碍与用户的精确交互。另一方面，小型硅基微机械换能器阵列只能在较小的区域内实现短距离的触觉反馈。Imec的FPD兼容薄膜pMUT技术本质上与显示器制造技术更兼容。因此，它为应用程序铺平了道路，具有前所未有的领域和深度的经验。Imec的FPD兼容薄膜pMUT阵列现在填补了大容量半空中应用的低频、高压器件的利基。在200～400 kHz的谐振频率范围内，空气中的峰值压力为1.5kPa，复制了在其基于硅晶圆的平台上成功演示的半空气触觉反馈性能指标。“我们目前为感兴趣的各方提供我们的FPD技术和原型解决方案的晶圆级演示。此外，我们正在寻找大规模生产大面积面板和板材的合作伙伴，“imec的MEMS超声波项目总监Erwin Hijzen说。“将我们的pMUT技术集成到大型面板和显示器中的可能性是我们在大面积传感器表面上实现愿景的一个关键里程碑。我们从用于体内成像的超声换能器开始，现在转向半空中应用，如触觉。“imec传感器和执行器研究员泽维尔·罗滕伯格总结道。
中文源标题: Imec开发兼容FPD技术的pMUT阵列
英文整编: Recently, a research team led by Belgian Microelectronics Research Center (IMEC) developed a piezoelectric micromachined ultrasonic transducer (pMUT) array technology compatible with flat panel display (FPD) technology. The air sound pressure of the array is higher than 1 kPa, which reaches the pressure level of realizing tactile and directional sound in the air, and can provide tactile feedback for intelligent systems. Under the condition of realizing aerial touch, the local pressure field generated by ultrasonic wave can make users "feel" light without touching objects. In addition, the new technology is compatible with FPD technology, and can work at resonant frequencies in the range of 200 ~ 400 kHz, resulting in a peak pressure of about 1. 5 kPa, successfully replicating the aerial tactile feedback performance index of silicon wafer platform. This research is expected to integrate pMUT technology into large panels and displays, and fill the technical gap of low-frequency and high-voltage devices for large-capacity air applications.

中文标题: GE的XA100发动机将为F-35创造新的任务可能性
整编内容:
“如果你要提供一支能够在那种环境下有效飞行并完成任务的空军，你必须解决很多问题，”退休的美国空军上将保罗·赫斯特在谈到太平洋战区时表示：“更简单地说，那里有很大的空间。”
赫斯特对此有第一手知识。他是美国太平洋战区空军的前指挥官。在广阔的战场上有效作战，这将是美国空军在可预见的未来的主要关注点，这就是为什么他表示用下一代自适应动力装置为F-35A换发必须是美国空军计划的一部分。
GE的AETP发动机XA100已经达到了美国空军最初的要求：燃油效率提高25%，热管理能力增加一倍，推力至少增加10%。赫斯特现在是GE的顾问，他指出XA100的三次测试活动——包括目前在空军阿诺德工程发展中心（AEDC）进行的一次测试——已经证明了这种能力的代际跳跃。
采用这种AETP发动机，F-35A航程可以更远，可以扩大任务，有更大的作战灵活性，可以不让加油机进入有争议的空域,，并的任务中的其他飞机腾出空间。打开了区域限制，扩展了作战环境。
空军的AETP（自适应发动机过渡计划）于2016年启动，正是出于这种考虑。GE和普惠公司正在测试该项目下的自适应循环发动机。AETP发动机是为F-35A设计的替代发动机，在冷却能力上也有很大的提升。这种冷却对于支持F-35即将到来的Block IV需求和未来升级的增长能力至关重要。
赫斯特指出，这只是燃油效率提高25%所带来的任务灵活性，还不算AETP提供的其他改进。推力的提高和热管理的加强带来了同样重要的任务利益。热管理对于F-35的短期和长期需求都是至关重要的。因为F-35的热管理需求正在增长，并且还将继续增长。AETP的热管理能力是目前的两倍，这意味着有足够的冷却能力来吸收各种内部系统的热量。
近年来基于模型的系统工程的改进也有助于GE XA100的设计建模和性能预测。今天的发动机物理测试证明了测试前建模和预测的准确性。在AEDC的测试是长期风险缓解策略的一部分，赫斯特认为空军采用这种策略是明智的：“无论是新发动机还是升级发动机，喷气发动机的开发和设计总有一个学习曲线。但是，空军组织其自适应发动机项目的方式，有条不紊地完成多个项目，并为这些项目提供一致的资金，已经允许消除大量的风险。这使得空军能够在工程和制造开发项目之前知道他们将得到什么。”
数字工程也给了GE信心，其发动机不仅适用于AETP目标设计的F-35A，也适用于舰载的F-35C。GE为这两型飞机提供了一个零件号通用的发动机，占计划中的F-35机队的近90%。

源标题: GE’s XA100 Engine Would Create New Mission Possibilities for the F-35
原文:
Aug. 9, 2022 | By Nick Adde
“You must solve a lot of problems if you’re going to provide an Air Force that can fly effectively and complete its missions in that environment,” Retired U.S. Air Force Gen. Paul Hester said of the Pacific theater. Put more simply, “There’s a lot of room out there,” he said.
Hester has firsthand knowledge of this. He’s a former commander of USAF Pacific Air Forces. Operating effectively in that expansive theater, which will be a major focus of the USAF for the foreseeable future, is why he says re-engining the stealthy, multi-mission F-35A with a next-generation, adaptive powerplant must be part of the USAF’s plans.
GE’s AETP offering, called the XA100, has delivered on the Air Force’s original ask: 25% better fuel efficiency, twice the thermal management capacity, and at least 10% more thrust. Hester, who now consults for GE, notes the XA100’s three test campaigns—including one currently taking place at the Air Force’s Arnold Engineering Development Complex （AEDC）—have demonstrated that generational jump in capability.
From a mission planning perspective, Hester says the effect such an engine would have in combat would be enormous. “More ‘miles per gallon’ means I can fly that much farther,” he said. “From a mission planner’s point of view, more range means you can complicate your adversary’s problems. Plus, I’m able to react better, with more options, to things that an adversary throws at me.”
“I’m able to expand my mission and pick different airfields I can operate from. I can take tankers away from contested airspace, and free up their availability for other aircraft that are part of my mission. I’ve opened up my envelope, my operational environment.”
The Air Force’s AETP （Adaptive Engine Transition Program）started in 2016 with this exact scenario in mind. General Electric （GE）and Pratt & Whitney are testing engines under this program with adaptive cycle engines that generate more power when you need it and then adapt for greater efficiency while cruising to extend the jet’s range. The AETP engines, designed as drop-in replacement engines for the F-35A, also provide a significant jump in cooling capability. That cooling is critical to support the F-35’s impending Block IV needs and capacity for growth in upcoming upgrades.
Hester notes that’s just the mission flexibility afforded by 25% better fuel efficiency. “That doesn’t account for the other improvements AETP provides,” he says.
Improvements in thrust and enhanced thermal management bring along similarly important mission benefits. Thrust, Hester notes as a former fighter pilot, “is something you can never get enough of. It increases your potential payload and your ability to get out of challenging situations.”
Thermal management is an area Hester notes is essential for both the short term and long term needs of the F-35 platform.
“The F-35’s thermal needs are growing,” he said. “And they’ll continue to grow as the jet modernizes throughout its service life. AETP brings double today’s thermal management capacity, which means plenty of cooling availability to absorb heat off various internal systems. The three-stream architecture AETP introduces, as opposed to the current two-stream architecture, is the key to solving the overheating problems we see today.”
Improvements in model-based systems engineering in recent years have also helped model the design and predict performance of GE’s XA100. Today’s tests of a physical engine are proving the accuracy of pre-test modeling and predictions.
“[The XA100] has tested at Air Force facilities in Tullahoma, Tennessee,” Hester said. “Through those tests, you’re able to look against the predicted ability of the engine to operate across the flight envelope and see where the actual data points are.”
The tests at AEDC are part of a long-term risk mitigation strategy Hester says the Air Force was wise to employ. “There is always a learning curve with jet engine development and design, whether it’s a new engine or an upgrade. But the way the Air Force structured its adaptive engine programs, methodically working through multiple programs and providing consistent funding for those programs, has allowed a significant amount of risk to be removed. That allows the Air Force to know what they’re getting before an Engineering and Manufacturing Development program.”
Digital engineering also has given GE the confidence that its engine fits not just the AETP target design vehicle in the F-35A, but also the carrier-based F-35C. GE has a part-number common engine for both aircraft, representing nearly 90% of the planned F-35 fleet.
“The most advanced aircraft in the world should have an engine to match,” Hester said. “The benefits are clear, and we need to move forward now to outpace an increasingly competitive environment.”

中文标题: 朝鲜再次成功发射“火星-15”洲际弹道导弹
整编内容:
朝鲜当地时间2月18日17点20分左右，朝鲜在平壤国际机场高角度成功再次发射1枚“火星-15”洲际弹道导弹。朝鲜媒体表示，朝鲜本次发射是一次“突击”演习的一部分，其目的旨在再次确认和验证武器系统的机动和强大的反击能力和可靠性，同时凸显朝鲜核武战备状态。
据朝鲜媒体报道，此次发射未提前计划，而是按照朝鲜领导人金正恩2月17日凌晨发布了模拟“紧急火力战斗待命命令”的紧急指示，以及当天上午金正恩下达的命令书紧急组织进行的。本次试验中，“火星-15”导弹最大高度5768.5千米，飞行距离989千米，飞行时间约4015秒（67分），并精确打击了位于朝鲜东部公海的目标水域，在本次发射评估中获得“优异的成绩”。
朝鲜劳动党中央委员会副部长金与正19日发表谈话，抨击美国和韩国打着应对威胁的招牌大肆叫嚣扩张遏制力。金与正警告，朝方将密切关注敌人的一举一动，并将做出“与之相应的、强有力的压倒性应对”。
美韩2月1日举行了今年首次联合空中演习，22日将再次举行空中演习，3月中旬还将举行代号为“自由护盾”的联合军演。
韩国联合参谋本部19日表示，韩美当天在朝鲜半岛上空实施了联合空演，并投入了美国战略武器。此次演习的内容是，韩国空军F-35A和F-15K战斗机、美国空军F-16战机，为进入韩国防空识别区的美军B-1B战略轰炸机进行护航并实施联合编队飞行。10余架两国战斗机参演，这些战机从半岛西部海域穿越南部地区飞往东部海域。
韩国联合参谋本部表示，此次演习通过及时迅速调遣美国延伸威慑战斗力，展现了韩美同盟依据压倒性战力的联防能力和态势。
针对美韩19日开展的联合军演，朝鲜劳动党中央委员会副部长金与正19日还发表谈话称，美国和韩国动辄打出应对威胁之招牌，大肆喧嚷扩张遏制力和联合防卫态势，公开暴露出要在朝鲜半岛地区取得军事优势、占据支配地位的十分危险、极为过度的野心和企图，这将越来越破坏地区稳定，导致形势岌岌可危。
金与正还受委托警告称：“我们将密切关注敌人的一举一动。针对我们的敌对行为，每次将予以与之相应的、强有力的压倒性应对。”
本次发射是火星-15导弹开展的第二次飞行试验，2017年11月29日，朝鲜由平安南道平城市一带向朝鲜半岛东部海域方向首次发射1枚“火星-15”远程弹道导弹，飞行距离约950km，最大高度约4475km，飞行约53分钟后，落入日本海，飞行试验取得圆满成功。

源标题: North Korea says it tested ICBM in surprise drill
原文:
Kim Yo Jong threatens ‘overwhelming response’ to hostility after test of new missile unit’s readiness
Colin ZwirkoFebruary 19, 2023
SHARE
A state media image of the Hwasong-15 ICBM launching from a dedicated mobile launch vehicle on Feb. 18 | Image: Rodong Sinmun (Feb. 19, 2023)
North Korea launched a Hwasong-15 intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) onSaturdayas a warning to the U.S. and South Korea and to test the readiness of special units under the military’s new Missile General Bureau, according to state media.
TheKorean Central News Agency(KCNA)reportedSunday that the launch ordered on short notice proves the reliability of Pyongyang’s nuclear weapons and “capacity for fatal nuclear counterattack on the hostile forces,” stating “military threats of the U.S. and south Korea are getting serious to the extent that can not be overlooked.”
Kim Yo Jong, sister of DPRK leader Kim Jong Un, also warned Seoul and Washington of an “overwhelming response” to perceived “hostility” in a separate statementreleasedbyKCNAon Sunday.
Sunday’s warnings came days after a foreign ministry spokespersonthreatened“unprecedented” counteractions if the U.S. and South Korea carry out large-scale joint drills in the coming weeks as planned.
More images published Sunday of the previous day’s Hwasong-15 ICBM launch | Images: KCNA (Feb. 19, 2023)
ICBM LAUNCH
KCNA reported that the First Red Flag Hero Company launched the ICBM on Saturday from Pyongyang International Airport and that it accurately struck a target area in international waters in the East Sea (Sea of Japan) around 614 miles (989 km) away, reaching a maximum altitude of around 3,584 miles (5,768 km) and flying for 66 minutes total.
This roughly matches flight datapublished earlierby the South Korean and Japanese militaries, which said the missile launched around 5:22 p.m. KST and flew 560 miles. Japan additionally claimed the missile landed 125 miles (200 km) off its west coast, and video emerged purporting to show a large flaming object coming down on the horizon.
DPRK leader Kim Jong Un’s presence at the test was not mentioned in Sunday’s KCNA report, but it said he initially gave a hand-signed order for the “surprise” readiness drill at 8 a.m. KST, or over nine hours before launch.
Ankit Panda, Stanton Senior Fellow in the Nuclear Policy Program at the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace, toldNK Newsthat while the unit received an “excellent mark” for succeeding in the test-launch, the nine hours from order to launch is “hardly going to be satisfying in the long-run” for Kim under more urgent circumstances.
“Moving out from ballistic missile operating areas in the northern [regions] on rougher roads would be more challenging presumably” than operating at the Pyongyang airport, Panda added.
State media image of a Hwasong-15 ICBM flying upward from Pyongyang International Airport on Feb. 18 | Image: KCNA (Feb. 19, 2023)
Following the launch, the party Central Military Commission (CMC) commended ICBM units for being “ready for mobile and mighty counterattack” and “gave all the missile units … an order to thoroughly maintain their strengthened combat readiness,” according to the KCNA.
North Korea last launched an ICBMin November, when it conducted its first successful test of the more powerful Hwasong-17 ICBM. That launch was reportedly carried out by the same First Red Flag Hero Company that conducted Saturday’s test.
Pyongyang issuspectedof launching a Hwasong-15 or similar missile in March 2022 in order to produce verifiable flight data for use in adeceptive reporton what itclaimedwas its actual first successful Hwasong-17 test.
The last time state media reported on a Hwasong-15 test was its inaugural launch inNov. 2017. State media also reported the launch of a similar-looking ICBM inOct. 2022.
Sunday’s KCNA report marked the first mention in state media of the military’s Missile General Bureau (MGB), which appears to be in charge of nuclear weapons units. The organization’s flag, whichappearedfor the first time in state media earlier this month, says it was established in April 2016.
Later Sunday, Seoul’s Joint Chiefs of Staff announced that the U.S. and South Korea conducted joint air drills the same day involving U.S. B-1B strategic bombers, as well ROK F-35A and F-15K fighters and U.S. F-16 fighters, in a demonstration of Washington’s commitment to “extended deterrence.”
Soldiers of the First Red Flag Hero Company under the Missile General Bureau celebrate the launch inside what appears to be a mobile control room | Image: KCTV (Feb. 19, 2023)The Hwasong-15 ICBM did not feature in the Feb. 8 military parade, where the Missile General Bureau flag led a column of 12 Hwasong-17 ICBMs and five new solid-fuel ICBM launch vehicles. The flag says the MGB was established in April 2016, but it is likely a newly reorganized division given that it only first appeared in state media this month. | Images: KCTV (Feb. 7 (left), Feb. 9 (right), 2023)
KIM YO JONG WARNING

In a separate KCNA statement, Kim Yo Jong, the sister of North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, reiterated Pyongyang’s earlier accusation that the United States was using the United Nations Security Council as a “heinous anti-DPRK hostile policy implementation body.”
DPRK is the acronym for North Korea’s official name, the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea.

中文标题: Jetoptera将在风洞中测试HSVTOL验证机概念
整编内容:
美国初创公司Jetoptera计划测试一种集成引射推进和上翼面吹气的翼身融合模型，公司试图赢得美国空军的一份合同，以制造一架高速垂直/短距起降原型机。
在Jetoptera的无叶片引射推进系统（FPS，Fluidic Propulsive System）中，来自气体发生器的高压空气被分配到推进器。在推进器中，高压空气被喷射到涵道中，进而吸入并加速大量的环境空气以增加推力。
在这家初创公司的Hedwig 验证机概念中，FPS与上翼面吹气相结合，一组推进器吹过襟翼系统，以增加垂直和低速飞行时的升力。高速飞行时，推进器和襟翼缩回机翼以最小化阻力。
Jetoptera正在与诺斯罗普·格鲁曼公司合作，同时其Scaled Composites部门和普惠公司合作，为高速垂直起降（HSVTOL）概念挑战赛提出Hedwig概念，该挑战赛由空军AFWerx创新部门与特种作战司令部合作举办。
这家总部位于华盛顿州的初创公司是2021年8月获得第一阶段合同的11家公司之一，旨在为2025年飞行的HSVTOL验证机和2030年的作战飞机开发概念。第一阶段可行性研究于6月完成。
概念机是一架重227kg（500磅）的40%缩比模型。根据5月授予Jetoptera的一份为期12个月、价值75万美元的小型企业技术转让合同，Hedwig翼身融合HSVTOL验证机概念将在华盛顿大学的Kirsten风洞中进行测试，
根据另一份75万美元的小型企业创新研究合同，Jetoptera公司在Kirsten风洞中对一段机翼和襟翼系统使用FPS和上翼面吹气验证了升力增加。Jetoptera表示，与使用分布式螺旋桨对机翼吹风的其他短距起飞和着陆方案相比，Hedwig概念升力系数高出约30%。
